Strong Q4 & FY25 Results:JSW Infrastructure announced strong financial results for the fourth quarter (Q4) and fiscal year 2025.

Cargo Volumes:The company handled cargo volumes of 31.2 million tonnes in Q4 FY25, a 5% year-on-year increase. For the full year, cargo volumes reached 117 million tonnes, up 9% year-on-year.

Revenue Growth:Total revenue for Q4 FY25 increased by 14% year-on-year to ₹1,372 crore. For the full year, total revenue grew by 20% year-on-year to ₹4,829 crore.

Profitability:Profit after tax (PAT) for Q4 FY25 was ₹516 crore, a 57% year-on-year increase. Full-year PAT stood at ₹1,521 crore, up 31% year-on-year.

Dividend Recommendation:The board recommended a dividend of ₹0.80 per share, subject to shareholder approval.

As of May 1, 2025, JSW Infrastructure (JSWINFRA) showed positive financial performance and expansion initiatives.

Financial Performance

Operational Highlights JSW Infrastructure saw an increase in third-party cargo, which accounted for 49% of overall volumes in FY25. The company also pursued expansion through new projects and acquisitions. This included receiving an LOI for the Murbe Port, acquiring a majority stake in Navkar Corporation Limited to enter the logistics sector, starting interim operations at the JNPA Liquid Terminal and Tuticorin Terminal, and completing the acquisition of the Slurry Pipeline Business with a long-term agreement with JSW Steel Ltd.

Strategic Initiatives & Recognition The company plans to significantly increase its cargo handling capacity to 400 MTPA by FY30 with a capital expenditure of ₹30,000 crores. An additional ₹9,000 crores is allocated for logistics expansion. Jaigarh Port was awarded the "Sword of Honour" by the British Safety Council.

Positive Outlook ICICI Securities gave JSWINFRA a "Buy" rating with a target price of ₹345 as of May 1, 2025.
